title: Reaction mechanism nitrogen dioxide and fluorine

content.question: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas, plus F 2 gas, react to produce N O 2 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta H naught of reaction, equals negative 284 kilojoules per mole of reaction"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>284</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="N O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> can react to produce <math alttext="N O 2 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F(g)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented above. A proposed mechanism for the reaction has two elementary steps, as shown below. Step 1: <math alttext="N O 2, plus F 2, react to produce N O 2 F, plus F"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="N O 2, plus F, react to produce N O 2 F"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) (a) Write a rate law for the overall reaction that is consistent with the proposed mechanism.

frqParts.text: For parts of the free-response question that require calculations, clearly show the method used and the steps involved in arriving at your answers. You must show your work to receive credit for your answer. Examples and equations may be included in your answers where appropriate. <math alttext="2 N O 2 gas, plus F 2 gas, react to produce N O 2 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta H naught of reaction, equals negative 284 kilojoules per mole of reaction"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>H</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>∘</mo></mrow></msubsup><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>284</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>kJ/mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="N O 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="F 2 gas"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> can react to produce <math alttext="N O 2 F gas"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F(g)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as represented above. A proposed mechanism for the reaction has two elementary steps, as shown below. Step 1: <math alttext="N O 2, plus F 2, react to produce N O 2 F, plus F"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (slow) Step 2: <math alttext="N O 2, plus F, react to produce N O 2 F"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mtext>F</mtext><mo>→</mo><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> (fast) (a) Write a rate law for the overall reaction that is consistent with the proposed mechanism.

(b) On the incomplete reaction energy diagram below, draw a curve that shows the following two details. The relative activation energies of the two elementary steps The enthalpy change of the overall reaction

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
